CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The error message is directly concatenated with a string and set as the value of the CodeMirror instance (cm). If the error message is user-controlled input, it could include malicious scripts, which would then be executed in the context of the user's browser when the error message is displayed. This could lead to a variety of attacks, such as stealing the user's session cookies or performing actions on their behalf.
